Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Alberto Lopez, AUSA Ernesto Lopez, Ms. Luz Rios and PTO E. Jimenez.Arraignment as to Gregorio Reyes-Zavala (9) Count 1,1s,2,2s,3,3s,4,4s,5,5s,6,6s,7,7s held on 10/21/2009. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days  for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Garcia for trial scheduling. Detention Hearing as to Gregorio Reyes-Zavala held on  10/21/2009. Ms. Rios stated for the record that at this time they had nothing to offer as to bail. Defendant is ordered detained w/out bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter - FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 03:30.Hearing held at 04:35.Hearing ended at 04:40. (yr) (Entered: 10/30/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Alberto Lopez, AUSA Ernesto Lopez, Mr. Ramon Gonzalez and PTO E. Jimenez.Arraignment as to Hector L. Figueroa-Mendez (10) Count 1,1s,2,2s,3,3s,4,4s,5,5s,6,68,7,7s held on 10/21/2009. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Garcia for trial scheduling. Detention Hearing as to Hector L. Figueroa-Mendez held on 10/21/2009. After hearing arguments from the parties, the Court set bail in the amount of $50,000.00 of which $25,000.00 are to be cash or secured, home detention with EM, employment or study, outpatient psychological treatment, UA and/or treatment, deft is not to enter the areas mentioned in the indictment, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 03:30.Hearing held at 04:35.Hearing ended at 04:45. (yr) (Entered: 10/30/2009)

Bustelo.Arraignment as to Rosa Guzman-Ortiz (13) Count 1, 1s, 2, 2s, 3, 3s, 4, 4s, 5, 5s,6,6s,7,7s held on 10/27/2009. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Garcia for trial scheduling. Bail Hearing as to Rosa Guzman-Ortiz held on 10/27/2009. Mr. Inserni addressed some issues as to the PT report prepared and requested that defendant be allowed to complete her term of imprisonment in Vega Alta where she presently was serving so that she could complete her therapy program and rehabilitation which she needs in order to be able to function. He also requested that after said term has been completed, that defendant be returned to MDC and then the issue of bail be revisited. Also that her time in Vega Alta prison count as to her possible sentence. The Court granted the request and issued a separate order so that the USM would transfer the defendant back to Vega Alta, with a detainer so that when her time there is completed, she is returned to MDC and the Court be notified. Detention Hearing as to Johanna Matos-Landron held on 12/21/2009. SAUSA Lopez stated for the record that the Government didn't object giving bail to this defendant due to her pregnancy, but suggested that the bail amount be increased. Mr. Masini argued in favor of adopting the recommendations made by PT as they were. The Court set bail in the amount of $20,000.00 of which $10,000.00 are to be cash or secured and $10,000.00 unsecured, she's to reside outside the Covadonga housing projet and she's not to enter or approach the areas mentioned in the indictment, curfew is to be imposed by PT, UA and/ or treatment as deemed appropriate by PT, plus all other standard conditions of release. Mr. Masini clarified for the Court that defendant's second last name is not Landron, but Landan. The Court ordered that the name be corrected. By now, Defendant has had ample time to enforce the orders issued by this Court for the procurement of the airline documents. The Court will not allow its schedule to be held hostage any longer. The interview SHALL be conducted by NO LATER THAN TOMORROW JANUARY 11, 2013, WITH OR WITHOUT THE PRESENCE OF DEFENDANT'S ATTORNEY, and WITH OR WITHOUT THE AVAILABILITY OF THE AIRLINE DOCUMENTATION. Signed by Judge Jay A Garcia-Gregory on 1/10/2012.(RJC) (Entered: 01/10/2013)

ORDER denying 755 Motion for Reconsideration as to Jose E. Esquilin-Birriel (4). The Court notes that the Orders in question were issued two months ago. Defendant had ample time to bring the airlines noncompliance to the Court's attention. Nevertheless, Defendant sat on his hands. Now, two months later and on the eve of sentencing, defendant requests a fourth continuance of the sentencing hearing. The Court will not cater to defendant's request. Further, as to defendant's request for issuance of a second subpoena for production of documents, the same is denied. The Court's first order to that effect did not have an expiration date. Signed by Judge Jay A Garcia-Gregory on 1/10/2012. (RJC) (Entered: 01/10/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Hector L. Figueroa-Mendez (10) held on 10/17/2013. Present: AUSA Marshal Morgan & AFPD Giovanni Canino. The parties informed the Court that they reached a stipulation. USPO is in agreement that deft did not violate standard condition #7 as stated in the Motion 791 . Deft concedes that he did violate the special condition inasmuch that he did not successfully complete the community corrections program. The Court accepted the parties stipulation. The Court deemed that there is probable cause. The Court found that deft did in fact violate the special condition but found that condition #7 was not violated. The matter is referred to Judge Jay A. Garcia Gregory for the setting of a Final Revocation Hearing. The govt  was heard as to detention. Defense counsel was heard as to release. The Court ordered deft to be released under the same conditions of supervised release as were imposed by Judge Jay A. Garcia Gregory. Deft to be released FORTHWITH. (USPO Desiree Reyes, Court Reporter FTR, Interpreter N/A) (Hearing was set for 9:00 a.m., held at 10:54- 10:59 a.m.) (mc) (Entered: 10/17/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Hector L. Figueroa-Mendez held on 1/28/2014. Present were AUSA Alberto Lopez and AFPD Giovanni Canino. Defendant was present and under custody. The Government called USPO Desiree Reyes to testify. Direct and cross-examination conducted. Sidebar held. After hearing the testimony of the officer and holding a sidebar conference, the Court finds that there's no probable cause that a new violation to his supervised release has been commited, but taking into account that defendant is pending a final revocation hearing before Judge Garcia for another violation in which probable cause was found, the Court offered as an alternative to incarceration is to reside at a half-way house to be determined by Probation and receive mental health treatment as well as all other conditions of supervised release previously imposed. After AFPD Canino conferred with defendant, defendant accepted this proposal. USPO Reyes informed that the housing contractor will pick him up either tonight or tomorrow at MDC, and that arrangements had already been made. The Court approved this alternative and exhorted defendant to take advantage of this opportunity being afforded. MDC will release defendant to the custody of this program as soon as possible. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:18.Hearing ended at 03:59. Interpreter -Enith Valdez. (yr) (Entered: 01/29/2014)

Minute Order. for proceedings held beforeJudge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose Falu-Vega (15) held on 10/27/2015. Present were: AUSA Victor Acevedo, AFPD Eleonora Marranzini and USPO Abner Valcarcel. Defendant present U/C and assisted by the court interpreter. Defense counsel informed that defendant will not contest the violations. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of defendant. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, the supervised release term previously imposed is hereby revoked. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose Falu-Vega (15) held on 6/27/2017. AUSA Marc Chattah and AFPD Vivian Torralbas were present. Defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant did not contest the allegations and informed that defendant has an addiction problem and requested that he be released to a rehabilitation or housing to structure his life. The government had no objection, but only if the U.S. Probation Office believes that they could provide those resources. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. After having heard both parties in this case,  the Court finds that Mr. Jose Falu-Vega has violated the conditions of the supervised release term imposed, by actively using illegal controlled substances and failing to report to the probation office for urine collection. Therefore, the supervised release term imposed on October 27, 2015, is revoked. The Court imposed sentence to 12 months of imprisonment and 60 months of supervised release term. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (USPO Norma Martinez.) (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 04:07. Hearing ended at 04:22. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 07/07/2017)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Jose Falu-Vega (15), IMPR: 12 months and SRT: 60 months. Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 6/27/2017.(br) (Entered: 07/07/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos Pepin-Rivera (20) held on 6/27/2017. AUSA Marc Chattah and defense counsel Marie Cortes were present. Defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant did not contest the allegations. Counsel informed that defendant acknowledges that he has a drug addiction problem and is willing to receive treatment. The government agreed with the Court's recommendation. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. After having heard both parties in this case, the court finds that Mr. Carlos Pepin-Rivera violated the conditions of his supervised release term by failing to truthfully answer all inquiries and failing to follow instructions form the Probation Officer, failing to refrain from the use of controlled substances, failing to submit to random drug testing procedures as established by the U.S. Probation Office and failing to work regularly at a lawful occupation. All violations were cited in the motion filed by the United States Probation Officer on October 19, 2016, (Docket No.936). Therefore, the supervised release term imposed on December 10, 2010, is hereby revoked. The Court imposed sentence to 10 months of imprisonment and 24 months of supervised release term. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (USPO Elsie Tofani.) (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 04:23. Hearing ended at 04:38. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 07/07/2017)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Carlos Pepin-Rivera (20), IMPR: 10 months and SRT: 24 months. Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 6/27/2017.(br) (Entered: 07/07/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Silvana Benitez-Rivera (18) held on 6/27/2017. AUSA Marc Chattah and AFPD Joannie Plaza were present. Defendant was present, on bond and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant did not dispute the allegations and accepted that she violated the conditions. Counsel requested that she remain in Guarabi and that time served be granted. The government had no objection with the recommendation. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. After having heard both parties in this case, the court finds that Mrs. Benitez-Rivera violated the conditions of her supervised release term by failing to refrain from the use of controlled substances and failing to submit to random drug test procedures as established by the U.S. Probation Office. All violations were cited in the motion filed by the United States Probation Officer on October19, 2016, (Docket No. 935) and subsequently on a Supplemental Motion filed on 11/21/2016, (Docket No. 956). Therefore, the supervised release term imposed on February 3, 2011, is hereby revoked. The Court imposed sentence to TIME ALREADY SERVED and 5 years of supervised release term. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (USPO Elsie Tofani.) (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 04:40. Hearing ended at 04:54. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 07/07/2017)

ORDER - STRICKEN FROM THE RECORD. 1063 LETTER MOTION filed by Hector Cruz-Herrera (6), pro se. In this district, all documents must be filed in English or accompanied by a certified English translation, as required by 48 U.S.C. § 864 ("[alll pleadings and proceedings in the United States District Court for the District of Puerto Rico shall be conducted in the English language") and Local Criminal Rule 112, which provides that motion practice in criminal cases shall be subject to Local Civil Rule 5(g) ('[a|ll documents not in the English language which are presented or filed, whether as evidence or otherwise, must be accompanied by a certified translation into English prepared by an interpreter certified by the Administrative Office of the United States Courts"). Moreover, as Defendant is represented by counsel, he should file any requests through counsel.Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 9/4/18. (su) (Entered: 09/04/2018)

** AMENDED ** Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Hector Cruz-Herrera (6) held on 12/12/2018. Present were AUSA Seth Erbe and AFPD Yasmin Irizarry. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed and approved. Probable cause found as to the violations alleged in dockets 1060 and 1068, and the case was referred to Judge Garcia for the revocation hearing. AUSA Erbe stated that given defendant's mental health history, it would perhaps be appropriate that he be evaluated and receive treatment if found necessary. Sidebar held. AFPD Irizarry stated for the record that after speaking with USPO Santana, present in Court, they found that this was appropriate, and that defendant had no objection to being transfer to the mainland to an institution where he can be evaluated and receive treatment. After hearing from all the parties, the Court ordered that defendant receive a mental health evaluation as well as treatment, if deemed appropriate; and order the USM to transfer defendant to an institution on the mainland where this evaluation can be performed and treatment received, as soon as possible. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos M. Reyes-Aleman (19) held on 2/4/2021. SAUSA Michelle Colon, AFPD Alejandra Bird and SUSPO Abner Varcarcel were present via VTC. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations at ECF No. 1020 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The FPD was appointed to represent the defendant. AFPD Bird requested conditions of release. The government moved for detention. SUSPO Varcarcel's statements were heard. The defendant was ordered temporarily detained. A preliminary revocation hearing was set for 2/19/2021 at 11:00 am via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. As required by Rule 5(f), the United States is ordered to produce all exculpatory evidence to the defendant pursuant to Brady v. Maryland and its progeny. Not doing so in a timely manner may result in sanctions, including exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges and contempt proceedings. Court Reporter Zoom Recording. Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 02:01. Hearing ended at 02:34. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (jjr) (Entered: 02/05/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos M. Reyes-Aleman (19) held via VTC on 4/26/2021. Present were AUSA Steven Liong, APFD Coral Rodriguez and USPO Abner Valcarcel. Defendant under custody, present in court via VTC and assisted by an official court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically for this proceeding and agreed to proceed with the via VTC due to the COVID-19 emergency and pursuant to CARES Act, § 15002(b)(1). Defendant does not contest the alleged violations. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendants allocution heard. After hearing the parties, the Court revokes the previously imposed SRT and sentenced defendant to 6 months of imprisonment and SRT of 2 years. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. Defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Rachelle Robinson.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:58.Hearing ended at 02:50.Interpreter Mayra Cardona. (su) (Entered: 04/27/2021)
